The food is really delicious i recommend the sour fish and soup dumplings its good for kids and for elderly basically a good fit for everyone! Great place for gatherings and reunions

Delicious traditional soup, dumplings, and fried rice very flavorful the staff and atmosphere is very welcoming. Extremely clean and cozy. I would definitely come here again

I recently visited Dinâ€™s Kitchen and I was blown away by the entire experience. From the moment I walked in, the atmosphere was warm and welcoming, with just the right mix of cozy and modern. The staff was attentive, friendly, and quick to make sure everything was perfect throughout the meal.

Din Kitchen is hands down one of the best dining experiences Iâ€™ve had in a while. The food is flavorful, fresh, and presented beautifully â€” you can really tell they use quality ingredients. Portions are generous without being overwhelming. The staff are warm, attentive, and make you feel welcome from start to finish. The atmosphere is cozy yet modern, perfect for any occasion. Highly recommend and Iâ€™ll definitely be returning!

Fish was really bad. They explained the fish was frozen and shipped from china. It tasted rubbery and stale.
Went there for soup dumplings as it was recommended. There was no soup in the dumplings. The dumplings itself were chewy. Hot and sour soup was pretty good.

Stumbled upon this place based on reviews and had the best meal! We ate the saliva chicken, dry pot cauliflower, and some dumplings. Absolutely delicious, some new flavors for me, and good service / vibes. Would recommend!

Been here a couple times and itâ€™s been excellent each time. The dry pot cauliflower is the best cauliflower iâ€™ve ever had and the mapo tofu and soup dumplings are fabulous. Definitely worth a visit (or several)

This dish looks absolutely mouthwatering! The fish slices appear tender and expertly cooked, with a beautiful golden sheen from the oil and spices. The vibrant red chili peppers add a perfect touch of heat, while the sesame seeds and other seasonings give it a complex, rich aroma. The plating in the metal pot enhances its authenticity, making it feel like a truly indulgent and flavorful experience. I can almost taste the delicious balance of spice, umami, and freshness just by looking at it!

Very good! We got soup dumpling and the pan fried bar.  We recommend.  We got a very large and yummy malatang.  They gave us a free kelp salad as appetizer and grass jelly for dessert :) we spent over $20/person but you could get away with much less
My kids love the noodles and the pancakes. The crabs' meat dumplings are so good. Yummy ğŸ˜‹

If you love the fiery, numbing kick of Sichuan cuisine, this is a must-visit. This place delivers an authentic Mala Xiangguo experienceâ€”bold, aromatic, and packed with layers of spice.
The Mala Xiangguo Experience
I ordered their. Signature dry pot with a mix of meats (beef, chicken, and shrimp) and veggies (lotus root, wood ear mushrooms, and cabbage). The first bite hit me with that classic mÃ¡ and punch from Sichuan peppercorns and dried chilies.

Their lunch special was such a fun way to try this new spot  We had to try their dumplings which were next level and then each had the spicy hot pot, which was loaded with fresh veggies alongside beautiful tender shrimp and pork (my husband did pork and beef) but you could choose from a list of proteins. Also, the staff were so friendly and helpful! We will definitely we back again and again to try one of everything on the menu!
The Sichuan food is amazing â€” the Mouthwatering Chicken is especially flavorful. Iâ€™d highly recommend giving this place a try

Absolutely incredible restaurant. Our favorite items were the Pork Soup Dumplings, seafood rice noodles and the Mapo Tofu, but everything we ate was amazing. The service is great and they were so helpful with menu recommendations. Highly recommend a visit Iâ€™ll be back for sure.
Pork, Shrimp and Mushroom dumpling were my favorite. Mapo tofu is also very good. Will definitely be coming back.

First time eating dumplings in the area and it was really delicious.  Had a couple of dumpling options and all taste very good, but for me, the best ones were definitely the soul dumplings. WOW! I will be back.

Awesome food with authentic dishes! Great service! They were very attentive and git food to us in a quick and timely fashion. We ate handmade pork leak dumplings,  gingko chicken soup, and scallion pancakes - superbly delicious ğŸ˜‹ ğŸ˜ ğŸ˜Š

I had an exceptional dining experience here! The food was incredibly tasty and expertly prepared, and the waitstaff were extremely helpful and genuinely friendly. I'm so glad I decided to visit this restaurant.

Good prices, good food!!! Very delicious!!! Fresh ingredients!!!! Came here after going taking the bus to Ststen Islsnd in the morning because I was meant to meet up with some friends to go to LUMON!!! (From severance!!) but i did not know the SIM buses only ran every 30 minutesâ€¦. I thought i was done forâ€¦â€¦ but luckily my dear friends waited for me and they got halal! And then we went to New Jersey and i bought 3 matcha lattes for the squad. Finally, after enjoying the sights, we headed back to Brooklyn over to here. We didnâ€™t know if the food would be enough (we have 6 people), so we also ordered the cumin beef. I thought it was just okay, but the veggies were great!!!! And the dry pot was very delicious - we ate every last bite. WOW! After this, i will take the train home and reflect on the delicious meal i just ate. ğŸ¤©

This place deserves their 5star rating with over 60 reviews at the time of writing; their food is delicious and also fairly priced.

We got 2 lunch specials, the dry pot and a mala soup, and a side of some soup dumplings. The soup and the dumplings were really good but man, that dry pot was fantastic. The flavor is amazing and they're not cheap with it; plenty of veggies and lots of meat. To finish it all, they gave some herbal jelly dessert at the end. Wonderful place for lunch or dinner.

A small dine in resto on 7th Ave., Brooklyn made its way to some flavorful dishes. A stand out was the spicy dry pot, which you can choose from mild to super hot. We chose the mild one, which was just right to add a mild kick for us. You can choose a minimum of 5 inclusions which range from meat, seafoods, vegs, and noodles. They will cook it for you. The taste was so temptingly delicious especially the meat; the shrimps were big; only the cuttle fish was a little overcooked that the pcs came chewy 4/5
The pork soup dumpling is also a plus, but a thinner dough is preferable. 3/5
The ginger/soy/vinegar sauce complimented it
The coco milk was just perfect for a drink, not sweet and the coco milk itself was not overpowering 4/5
The jasmine tea is great, too 5/5
The bottled sparkling orange juice is just right, too 4/5
There was a complimentary black gelatin with syrup as dessert. 4/5
The strips of seaweeds which was a complimentary appetizer was ordinary
We will try other dishes next time around.
super nice experience every time I went here! Chill environment, friendly service, and authentic chinese food ! go with any dishes and you won't be disappointedğŸ”®

We got a dry pot medium spicy with your own customized toppings, a shumai and a soup dumpling! You get a free appetizer seaweed as well! The water taste like chilled boiled water, not your regular tap.

Friendly and helpful service. The restaurant is very clean and has free wifi. Food was excellent - we had the scallion pancakes, pork soup dumplings, spicy sour shredded potato, and twice cooked pork. Also the mabo tofu and shumai. At the end of our meal they gave us sweet herbal jelly. We will definitely be going back to try more dishes.
This place has fast and friendly service and DELICIOUS food! Good for vegans and carnivores. We loved the cucumber salad, dry pot cauliflower, pork dumplings, and chili oil dumplings.

This dry pot is sublime. I love the simplicity in the menu and ordering. The food is served with beautiful presentation and elegant cutlery. å¥½åƒæäº†ï¼æˆ‘å–œæ¬¢è¿™å£å¹²é”…ï¼Œè¾£è¾£çš„, ä½†å‘³é“éå¸¸æµ“éƒ ğŸ˜‹

This place exceeded my expectations. Phenomenal customer service. Staff were very kind and knowledgeable of menu items. We ordered soup dumplings, pork trotters, sauerkrauts fatty beef noodle soup, salt and pepper popcorn chicken, scallion pancake and steamed dumplings. All were delicious and came out piping hot. Food was delicious. Would definitely come back again and try other items on the menu.

I extremely love this place. It clean and tidy, bright colors make me feel warm. The food is absolutely delicious to me. Food is served quickly. Food are fresh, taste good, and looks good. I really recommend this place and I will definitely come back again.

I recently had grilled fish and enjoyed it so much. The fish was really fresh, soft, and slightly smoky to the point of its grilled preparation. The flavor was light, with just the right amount of salt and herbs to enhance the natural taste without overpowering it. The outside was crunchy, with the inside still soft and flaky. It was served with steamed vegetables, which kept the food healthy and satiating. It was an overall delectably prepared, flavorful meal, which I would happily have again.

Went to Sunset Park knowing itâ€™s a destination for authentic Asian cuisine and this place did not disappoint. Everything was fresh, clean and delicious. Reasonably priced, quick and friendly service. Quite a lot to choose from on the menu. Some a little too exotic for my taste but not to those from where this food originated. Chef is from Shanghai if I understood correctly. This is the real deal. Will be back!
